title: Sun conjunct Mercury
summary: A moment of alignment between identity and thought. Expression feels more direct, ideas are easier to articulate, and decisions benefit from coherence between intention and reasoning.

meaning.headline: What you think and what you mean are easier to line up.

frames.text: Sun–Mercury conjunctions support clarity of expression: ideas move more cleanly from mind to voice or action.
This is a useful window for naming intentions, decisions, and perspectives that have been forming quietly.
Self-understanding improves when thoughts are spoken or written aloud.
Communication tends to feel more personal, because ideas are closely tied to identity.
This guarantees insight or intellectual success.

frictions: Becoming defensive when ideas are challenged
opportunities: Clarifying goals through writing or conversation
Making decisions with fewer internal contradictions
Integrating new information into a stable self-concept

do: Write or speak your thinking to refine it.
Ask clarifying questions to test your assumptions.
Use this alignment to resolve lingering indecision.
Separate ideas from identity when receiving feedback.
avoid: Rushing conclusions because things feel clear
Neglecting nuance for the sake of speed

reusable_lines.text: Clarity improves when intention and thinking move together.
Say it simply and see what holds.

forbidden_claims: Claims of superior intelligence or correctness
Framing identity as fixed by thoughts
allowed_framing: Contextual framing: 'if you’ve been sorting through ideas…'

sources: Sun–Mercury conjunction as identity/thought alignment archetype
